item.description:
W68- MIT Solar 7 House - the next generation of solar designers
JeffStein, Boston Architectural College, Boston, MA
6:00PM - 7:30PM-Wednesday


Student Panel Moderated by Jeff Stein AIA

They Did It! Architecture students from the BAC and from MIT discuss how in partnership they designed, developed, funded, constructed and ran a zero-energy solar house on the Washington Mall to compete in the US Department of Energy's 2007 Solar Decathlon. Now these student designer-builders talk about that experience, what they learned that you can profit from, and what comes next for them and for architecture in New England.

This is a session at the BSA's Residential Design & Construction conference. The cost is $10. You can preregister or pay at the door. Please read below:


  • If you are already registered to attend the conference, please call 1-800-544-1898 and tell them to add this event to your registration.

  • If you are not already registered for RDC and would like to attend, you can register at www.rdcboston.com

  • If you are not planning to attend any other sessions at RDC, but you want to register for this event or another evening event only, you can register as a "member of the public" at the door to avoid the exhibit hall fee.
item.name: MIT Solar 7 House - the next generation of solar designers
